title: Connecting Instagram and Facebook in Account Center

steps.title: Open Instagram.
steps.content: Open Instagram. This app icon features a camera lens on a gradient pink and orange background.

steps.title: Tap your profile picture.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture. It's in the lower right corner of your screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap ☰.
steps.content: Tap ☰ . This three-line menu icon is in the top right corner of your screen. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's next to a gear icon at the top of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Accounts Center . You'll see this at the bottom of the menu under the "Meta" header. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Set up Accounts Center.
steps.content: Tap Set up Accounts Center . This is usually the first option on the page. If you see a profile shown, you might already have your Instagram and Facebook accounts linked. [4] X Research source If you're not sure if your accounts are already linked, you can tap Accounts & profiles to see if both Facebook and Instagram are listed under the same account name.

steps.title: Tap Add accounts.
steps.content: Tap Add accounts . It's at the bottom of the menu and will prompt you to choose an account to add. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Log in to continue.
steps.content: Log in to continue. If your phone already detects your account (like if you saved your login information), you'll need to tap Continue and Add to proceed. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Decide if you want to sync info.
steps.content: Decide if you want to sync info. If you want your Facebook profile information to fill out your Instagram information (like your profile picture), tap your Facebook account, then tap the switch next to "Sync profile info" to enable it. [7] X Research source If you want to remove the account or unlink it from Instagram, you can tap Remove from Accounts Center on this page. [8] X Research source To cross-post to Instagram from Facebook or vice versa go to Accounts Center, then tap the account that you want to share from. You'll then be able to see what content is shared with your other accounts. [9] X Research source
